body:
(This probably belongs on –general, rather than –dev…)


The Qt-based rvu is located with all your other Windows Radiance programs, usually c:\Program Files\Radiance\bin. You can double-click the rvu.exe file and load an octree from there, or from the command line you can just type "rvu your_model.oct".


I am working on updated installers this week as well, so stay tuned for an update announcement.


Rob Guglielmetti
National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
Commercial Buildings Research Group
15013 Denver West Parkway MS:RSF202
Golden, CO 80401
303.275.4319
robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov






On 12/12/12 12:16 AM, "mazhi1982" <mazhi1982 at gmail.com<mailto:mazhi1982 at gmail.com>> wrote:




Hi,


     I have downloaded "Standard Windows one-click installer: radiance-4.2.a-win32.exe<http://openstudio.nrel.gov/accept/file/1043><http://openstudio.nrel.gov/accept/file/1043>" , but i don't know how to run Qt-based rvu on Windows Xp.


Best Regards,
MZ
